alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 8:10PM EDT until May 21 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL SOMERSET AND CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 809 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 28 miles southeast of Seboomook to 16 miles north of Bingham to near Weld, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Rangeley, Kingfield, Bingham, Carrabassett Valley, Phillips, Anson, Embden, Avon, Dallas Plantation, Brighton Plantation, Caratunk Plantation, Carrying Place, Solon, Strong, Lexington, Mount Abram, Industry, Highland Plantation and Wyman. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
